alert.note: Alert for Elliott; Johnson; Lee; Martin; Morgan; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 7:41PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A Gusty outflow boundary and strong storms will impact portions of northwestern Martin, Morgan, northeastern Owsley, Johnson, northwestern Breathitt, Magoffin, eastern Lee, Wolfe and southeastern Elliott Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 738 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a gusty outflow boundary along a line extending from near Culver to Pekin to St. Helens. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Culver around 745 PM EDT. Upper Gilmore and Lawson around 750 PM EDT. Lewis, Caney, Cannel City, Holliday, Adele, Williams, Belknap, White Oak, Elkatawa and Chandlerville around 755 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this outflow boundary and strong storms include Canoe, Lykins, Bethanna, Hager, Epson, Netty, Harper, Howard Creek, Burg, Curt, Stella, Kernie, Ova, Little, Gullett, Saldee, Copland, Gifford, Patton, Elsie, Salyersville, Hendricks, Lakesville, Fritz, Watts, Foraker, Stringtown, Clayhole, Chestnut, Perlie, Mason, Burning Fork, Mashfork, Conley and Falcon. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 42 and 76. U.S. Highway 23 in Johnson County between mile markers 5 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Elliott; Johnson; Lee; Martin; Morgan; Wolfe
